review_title: Altspace has perks over other platforms
one_reviews_text:
You can build worlds really easily using the built in world editor. Most of the functionality of managing worlds is done through the AltspaceVR website and you can join public groups to grow your asset collection and obtain new worlds to call your own. There are plenty of events around the clock but mostly during peak times, these events are different to other apps. What makes AltspaceVR great is the merge of world building and events. You can have your own private worlds or make them public. You can also grant flight and other building permissions to get others to help you. If you are into Unity3D you can use the uploader tool to upload your own world. If you want to implement user functions you can use the MRE SDK to code apps that can extend your ideas.

The platform isn't perfect but for an adult social VR app this app is often considered a hidden gem. Before joining, just be sure to toggle your Early access program and Worlds Beta in your menu. This will allow you to see user-generated worlds and this isn't toggled on by default and a key reason why people skip this app.

There are reviews regarding issues with this platform, Altspace has improved a mile with their accessibility and fixing most glitches. This platform isn't perfect but if you give it time it will weirdly grow on you. It has done some things that other platforms haven't done well and deserves a chance.

The game was awful, it was laggy and the menus where confusing to navigate, it wasn't a very vr friendly despite it being a vr game... a game similar to this is Rec Room, it works well on all devices, menus are easy to understand and it's vr friendly.
Can't even download. Says check connection. Every other single game in my library downloads fine

I love Altspace! I met so many cool people on Altspace since I first joined back in March 2021 and attended all types of events: clubs, birthday parties, holiday concerts, arena sessions, karaoke nights, bridal showers, church, shopping malls, etc. The avatars are the best I've seen compared to the other social apps. The Altspace developers are constantly updating the app making our VR experience even greater. There are amazing world and kit builders on here and some of the places I've seen are breathtaking. This is not the app for kids though--this is a grown up experience and it's so worth it. I love my Altspace family! #ChrisChris

I've made friends & worlds. After 2 years, still makes me go wow. I sometimes think I've seen it all then find the best world ever - again. The beauty of worlds brings tears to my eyes. I've been part of a group that made a film. I've met people from over 20 countries & learnt all sorts of things from the people I've met. There are interesting events on many subjects. You can do events yourself. I've been clubbing. When real church was in lockdown, I was able to go to VRchurch. I've spoken to some Italians, thanks to the translation feature in some worlds/events. People make me laugh with what they create. Some worlds don't just amaze me from a technical point of view but leave me wondering how on earth they came up with the idea for the design in the 1st place. There are opportunities to make money but there's no need to spend money if you can't or won't. Seen 3D worlds, pictures & films. You can take photos & look back on good memories with friends. Almost everyone wants to be your friend. No annoying kids like RecRoom. I've been to talks about things I wasn't interested in, only to find they were interesting. Art galleries not only made me go wow but the gallery itself was a work of art, & you can fly around & get another angle on things. Been able to get access to people with degrees in lots of subjects & learn from them - people you'd normally never get to talk to & they're so helpful. Been able to help others. I heard a frustrated world builder say, "You can't do that in Altspace" & was able to take him to a world where it was done & introduce him to the builder who taught him how. I heard another say, "When someone says, "You can't do that in Altspace", she responds with, "Challenge accepted". Even with problems, I know there are people working on solutions. Even after listing all these reasons for liking Altspace, I'm sure I'll think of more later. Thanks to eveyone for making it what it is.
they should rename it to boomer space.

review_title: For the price - it's still too expensive
one_reviews_text: Sure it's free.  However I just lost about an hour of my life (whatever that's worth) trying to just LOG ON!  Microsoft.com/devicelogin must be cruel joke.  The old "blue screen of death" aka BSOD was not as painful as this experience. What a POS.  Oh, You want to know  how I really feel?? - it's a POS.
review_feedback:
Hi, sorry to hear that you ran into this issue :( 

We've just fixed a bug related to this and you should be able to get in - if not, please reach out to our Support @ http://altvr.com/support

one_reviews_text: Used to be my favorite until I tried logging in one day. Now it literally wont even let me make a new account. ZERO STARS. Yall need to do better. I'm fckn pissed.
review_feedback:
Hi, sorry to hear that you ran into this issue :( 

We've just fixed a bug related to this and you should be able to get in - if not, please reach out to our Support @ http://altvr.com/support

review_title: For quest it's actually 5 stars but...
one_reviews_text: Maybe I'm wrong and I'm doing something not good but this app was one of the first that I started to use 5 years ago on Rift. It was really amazing, as I could set my own environment with an online player, where I could make my own parties. I used YouTube, and it worked so well! Now I returned back into the world of alt space with the quest, and I found it amazing. The places are smaller, but the characters look much more better. I tried to make my own home place again the same with music etc, but I couldn't. Some people told me that it was still possible, it just more complicated now... Okay, I thought that I just had to connect to my pc, to get the well used beautiful environment and the very useful features but whatever I tried it didn't work anymore. The graphics looks cool on quest, but to see the rift's version, I have to realise that it downgraded like hell. Again: it was much more beautiful 5 years ago, and it was a lot more easier to use YouTube videoplayer. To see those back steps made me extremely disappointed, and I really can't understand the reasons. 5 years ago, I used a geforce gtx 970 gpu, and I had no issues at all. Now I have an rtx3070 with I7 CPU with 2xmore RAM, and it has performance issues as hell, and yet the app became 20times more ugly! How is that possible?? I'm really sad to see that, something that was amazing became just a little funny thing. And it's free, so quest users going to enjoy it a lot, and I suggest to get it, but as a Rift user, it feels like it has lost its superpower, that I find very sad thing...

review_title: Not working well with my Rift
one_reviews_text: I'm on the rift. So I like the game when the worlds actually works. When I come into a event my sound is automatically turned off and the menu is not there any more. I can't see the drinks and other items that my quest friends are able to see. I would love to give five stars but even going in and out the room 7 times and it still doesn't work is too much.

No memes, no anime waifus, no dope avartars, no penguins on sicko mode, you litterally dont have limbs (if u dont manually set trackers to them -_- they need to learn how to use inverse kinematics), you will get bored VERY quickly, also the community of this game is so "boomer like"... or childish i doubt they can be classified as fellow gamers. smh

could not log on with Microsoft account and could not easily access the event.
Unistalling for now. Too bad.

The app itself is ok. I've looked into AltspaceVR off and on for 2 years now. I had high hopes because clearly they have money backing because they're owned by Microsoft, but the app feels "stuck". Nothing meaningful ever seems to change. It feels like (and not saying it's the case - but it FEELS like) the app has been abandonded by the developers. Apart from that they MUST change their advertising. All the banners and front page picture do NOT match what you're seeing in the app. I'm woefully reminded of what it felt to get your first sea monkeys thinking that they'll look at least similar to the pictures of the advertisements. AltspaceVR looks NOTHING like the banners would suggest. The Avatar graphics look like you're using an alpha build of an app and the graphics have not changed since 2018. My advice to the developers: pull this app into the 21st century, overhaul the graphics, spend some money on content, stop fixing things under the hood where we can't see it and make it obvious you're working on this.
Love this app, particularly good if you miss social contact during lockdown!

Way to waste over an hour of hundreds of people's time with this so called Pitbull event where literally nothing happened except a ~3 minute pre-recorded music video. This whole thing should have been 15 minutes max.
It’s not a game at all

review_title: Used to be good, but now...
one_reviews_text: When I first started, I used to have fun with HAH, playing videos with friends, and simply visiting worlds. Now... with the removal of the web browser from Windows VR, you have Quest users vs Rift/Vive/Index. PC users typically have to rely on buggy Multimedia Consoles made by the staff or higher-ups, whereas Quest can still enjoy the classic player that worked very well. Also, due to this, all but HAH games are gone. Sure, you can make a world easily, but without even basic entertainment, it's become nothing more than a meet-n-greet. I would not recommend this unless you are a Quest User, and can use the classic players.
review_feedback:
Hi Shilar, thanks for the feedback.

We removed the web browser from PC/PCVR due to security changes that needed to be made. Using the Multimedia Console, you can display images and play videos from YouTube, Twitch, etc.

Please join our Discord if you need help with anything :)

one_reviews_text:
After 5 years of Altspace, literally tens of thousand hours and over 4 different VR headsets. This is the final nail.

Removed stuff over the years.

#Arm and leg tracking
#Leapmotion support
#A decent back end SDK to develop on
#The best user created world editor *Shanes Editor* (replaced by a Chinese knockoff)
#Realistic spacial audio
#2D android support
#The most wildly used and loved avatar robots removed completely
#Soon to be gone, GearVR and Go support, as you don't know how to scale rendering
#The legacy movement and grab mechanics
#Marshmallows you can roast in the campfire
#Loads more other things too, but i'll say no more.


We've ripped all the old Altspace avatars and campfire to VRchat

See you there.

If you're thinking about getting this app then I would suggest you don't. They have moderators in there at almost all times, but if you're getting harassed then the moderators will do nothing about it and they'll also go out of their way to protect pedophiles that abduct and groom children. You read that right, there's already been one instance where a child has been abducted by someone they met on this app and they refused to help out in the investigation.
At the developer that responded, why don't you shut up and go do something useful like actually fix a bug for once in this app's history you incompotent human.

review_title: Used to be a fun place for adults.
one_reviews_text: With the sick and warped update of their avatars to child avatars clearly attracting children under 13 , they have created a child magnet online for child predators to pick and choose inocent minds to warp and control. This medium should be shut down immediatly. I deleted my account as soon as the new avatars came out.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear that you're not digging our Avatar update. Please send feedback through our Avatar Survey, we're sharing it with the team :) http://bit.ly/altspacejuly

one_reviews_text: I've been playing AltSpace for over a year, very often. It was a great cross-platform app for socializing, games, and creativity. Surprisingly, they managed to keep the community wholesome, friendly, safe, and comfortable. But with recent updates, they destroyed this app. With the new avatar update, the tone of the community is rapidly changing. They took away "our" safe space, to create "their" safe space. For example, I wanted to be neutral, so I was a robot avatar. Now they force me to be a human, and I can't even select my gender anymore. I can't be myself. Sad to say, I'm uninstalling this app, along with many other content creators.

The loss of the robot avatars was heartbreaking for many, but over all the new avatars are an improvement over the "muppets" previously used. If you hang around the campfire you will find a mix of people of all ages and be world hopping with friends in no time. This place contains everything from on-line Unity classes to VR churchs to Cards Against Humanity.  If you have not at least checked out Altspace you're missing something.
review_feedback: Glad to hear that you've had a good time in Altspace! We really appreciate  it :)

review_title: some mod was rude to me
one_reviews_text: the mod was talking about politics i told her to stop but they rudely told me to back away Loren joy was the mod who ban me for no reesen
review_feedback: Hi Ritzypolecat936 - please contact our Moderation support team, we'll be happy to look into this further https://altvr.com/support

one_reviews_text: I love the game it is very fun for the people who like to meet other people and hangout. But I was playing and I got suspended for 24 hrs. I hate the fact how people can report and get you suspended and or banned for no reason and any "Moderators" in the game did nothing about the kid who went around reporting everyone and getting them kicked/banned. Also excuse my grammer/word ussage I am abousloutley horible at grammer. This is edited version but I got my account back but then got perm banned.
review_feedback: Hi SandmansSon. Thanks for sharing some of your experience with us. Events and worlds are often moderated by the creators of those spaces. They have the ability to kick users from those spaces. However, only official AltspaceVR staff can enact a 24 hour or permanent suspension. If you believe you were incorrectly kicked from an event, send our team a report about it: altvr.com/report. Also, if you'd like to appeal a ban, we're always happy to investigate further. Just get in touch with our team: altvr.com/support. Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
My experience with this app goes as follows
Installed the app because I am interested in an ADHD seminar held the next day.
Next day I open the app for the first time and do the tutorial. It's fine so far but doesn't explain menus.
After tutorial i'm sent to a room (hub world maybe?) with other people in it... omg already? I'm a very shy person so this is kind of jarring. Oh well.
I walk around a bit by myself and hear a couple of young kids SCREAMING into their mics. Sounds terrible. But ok, it's a free app so it's a pretty common problem. 
I decide to sit on a chair (for immersion) and figure out the menus. I mute my own mic because I don't know how I feel about the app yet.
After about 2 mins of literally sitting there and figuring out how to join the ADHD event I was there to join I had to make an account before I'm allowed to enter. 
Started to make an account.
Person walks up to me.
Screen goes dark...
Message: You have been kicked for microphone abuse.

Mod kicked me. Missed seminar.
review_feedback: Hey LuckyNZ. Thanks for the feedback here. If you believe you've been removed from an event for insufficient reasons, you can report that issue to us for additional action. Our team would be more than happy to investigate further. To appeal a moderation action, please reach out to us directly at altvr.com/support. Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
What were some of the highlights at AltspaceVR?

The beautiful view of Campfire, the best place to hangout - if your microphone is mute otherwise you will get ban. (unless you suck up to the Moderators)

Be completely socially connected in a virtual space - with underage children and Admins. (unless you make a private space and invite your own friends)

Let your creativity kick in from VR world editor, take your experience to a whole new level - only if you like looking at lowpoly objects (limited 200<) Controls are a pain in the backside and it crashes if you upload more than 5 pictures. (unless you let Altspace tell you what you should build)

A powerful event section full of exciting places - that kids come together and  harassing eachother (unless you want to Meditate with Jeremy)

If you are a person who want to be yourself, with manners and respect for others, I encourage you to not install this app (unless otherwise you are children under 18 years of age, this is a perfect place for you)
review_feedback: Hi Thiefenergy. Thanks for the feedback. Sorry to hear you didn't enjoy your experience in AltspaceVR. It's not for everyone, we understand. We'll continue to build a product to help scale social connections & hope you'll give us a try in the future. If you've got any more specific feedback for our team, let us know at altvr.com/feedback. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: I got permanently banned right after creating my account and completing the tutorial. I didn't talk to or interact with anyone around me. I was in what I think was a lobby with maybe 3 others to join an event and I was permanently banned. I have no idea what happened.
review_feedback: Hi RamSack. Sorry to hear about that. Our team would be happy to investigate the issue further. Could you please reach out to us at altvr.com/support with some more details? Thanks so much.

review_title: i got perm cayden if you see this

review_feedback: Hey xXRizzleXx. Yes, sorry about that. Due to laws like COPPA, users of AltspaceVR must be 13+. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: It's useful and entertaining for meetups, conferences, panel discussions etc. The new avatars look nicer than the old ones - and they offer some interesting ways to customize them such as clothes and colours. Sadly there is no possibility to upload our own textures and mesh objects for avatars - in that regard  I prefer VRChat, Sansar and NeosVR. However, because Altspace has  simpler and less cusomizable avatars than the other platforms, it works well on less powerful hardware and it scales very well for large events with many people.. So I think Altspace has its own place, and I am glad about the recent update.
review_feedback: Thanks so much, it's great to hear that you're enjoying the new avatars!

review_feedback: Hi grundyboygirlyes. Thanks for flagging this. Please contact our moderation team to start an appeal: altvr.com/support. We're always happy to further investigate any moderation actions. Thanks!

review_feedback: Hi utsavchaudhary! Thanks for the feedback. Really appreciate hearing that you're enjoying our community. Thanks for being a part of it!

one_reviews_text: I was once kicked/banned for being a girl and defending myself.  That's been the only bad experience I've had here.  I generally have kept quiet since that incident but still love this place.  <3 I enjoy the style and when I do talk to people- it's always educational and intelligent conversations.

If you'd ever like to get in touch with us directly (either to ask for help or to share more thoughts) you can reach us at altvr.com/feedback or altvr.com/support Thanks so much!

one_reviews_text: If I wanted a low quality intern meeting I would have used Zoom
review_feedback: Hey aloelyptus. Sorry to hear you didn't enjoy your meeting! We recommend giving AltspaceVR's public hub spaces and live events a try. You can also find a lot of wonderful people in our Campfire. Let us know if you have any more feedback at altvr.com/feedback. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: This game is a very good place to play and chat with freidns! And moderators respond very quickly to low reviews! Amazing game!
review_feedback: Hey Prime5150! Thanks for the great feedback. Glad to hear you're really enjoying the social side of things in AltspaceVR. We always appreciate the insights from awesome community members like you!

review_title: Good Community. Mods need looking into.
one_reviews_text: I wanted to give this 4 or more stars but I do not like how the moderators treat people etc. First I saw someone get banned for a simply walking into a wall and glitching through the graphics (I mean, that's the developers issue and in no way the users fault) and then I got kicked out of a server myself. Someone kept kicking a kid from our game and for no reason whatsoever the kid thought it was me even though it wasn't. I assume the kid must have then reported me to a mod as I ended up getting kicked and barred from the server. They need to something about it as you could tell that everyone feels on edge all the time worrying they will get banned etc. The community and general game are good though, like a more close knit version of VRChat  (albeit very quiet, there are barely 50 people online most times I go on)
review_feedback: Hey NemoNine88! Thanks so much for the feedback. We really appreciate it. Please know we're always happy to look into an account ban or kick. All you have to do is open a ticket with our help desk: altvr.com/support/ You can also find an Admin in the Campfire at all times and let them know if you feel another user is abusing their moderation role in their own event. Thanks for helping us keep AltspaceVR welcoming, safe, and mature.

one_reviews_text: Okay, where do I start? Community? Cool. I have little complaints gameplay wise. However, where this game really goes down the toilet is who people employ as moderators. A group of people and I were chatting under a tree, and admittedly using some not kid friendly language. A moderator came over and rudely asked us to "knock it off" to which I proceeded to say "okay." after the conversation, the moderator said "Okay thanks bye" to which I responded "Yeah no problem cya" and she came back and said "Okay" and then banned me . Absolutely pathetic system of moderation, and overall the moderators are truthfully in another dimension of stupidity. Would recommend the game, would not recommend the morons who run it.
review_feedback: Hi Cactaclysm. Sorry to hear about this experience. You can open a ticket with our help desk and we can investigate the ban for you: help.altvr.com. That said, you can also review our Community Guidelines on our website to have a clearer understanding of what is and is not allowed in AltspaceVR.

one_reviews_text:
Has potential for social meet ups with ability to create your own world and host events in it such as maybe a live music concert, workout or meditation event. I need to spend time with the tools to see what's possible and re-do my review once I have a better grasp of how the APP functions.
*Update: now had a chance to gather some friends, attend several events and even create three worlds!  Awesome fun for sure! I can see the potential now and enjoying the experience. Certainly recommend this for sure!  One thing I would like to comment on is "negative comments" about moderators from some reviewers. I have had no problems and find them both helpful and friendly and always ready to assist.  If you behave like a morron or foul language then it is only right they should take action to protect the "Good atmosphere" of the platform as it is! Again I am enjoying the platform, making lots of new friends in the process!
review_feedback: Hey DavidVRblogs! Thanks so much for your wonderful feedback. We're so happy to hear you're enjoying your time in AltspaceVR. Thank you for being part of our community!

review_title: I Want To Give This Game 0 Stars
one_reviews_text: The Admins Hate Children, Its Stupid Because Children Should Be Able To Play It To, No Arms Is Also Pretty Disorienting, Needs Better Body Physics, Barely Any Good Worlds, Overall Trash Game.
review_feedback: Hi JacobKenagy. Thanks for your feedback. It's part of our Community Standards that all AltspaceVR users be at least 13 years old. This is the recommended age for VR in general, and for this reason it's important to us that we prioritize health and safety.

one_reviews_text: Free app that lets you attend open mic nights, virtual talk shows, games and you can even perform songs, stand up and pretty much anything you want to in front of a really friendly community =)
review_feedback: Hey HarbingerThrace. Thanks very much for your kind words. We're so glad to hear you're having a nice time in AltspaceVR. Our community of users is truly wonderful and we're glad to hear you've been checking out all that AltspaceVR has to offer!

review_title: Great space for lectures and talks
one_reviews_text:
This is great for lectures and talks but some of the UI is slightly confusing and hidden away until someone tells you how to find it. Perhaps a tutorial?
The world building is one of the most confusing things. What I think is intuitive: a palite menu with some defualt objects e.g. a cube, a plane, a cone, a spot light and a plus button at the top to import your own. Seperate to a details pannel that shows the options for the object selected. You should also be able to push the selected object away with the joystick (similar to oculus home).
review_feedback: Hi I_Electron_I. Thanks for the great feedback. The "Worlds" section of AltspaceVR is still a Beta feature, so we're working daily on making updates and improvements. Feedback like yours is always valuable, so thanks for sharing. If you'd like to send more thoughts our way, reach out to us at atlvr.com/feedback/ Thanks so much! Glad to have you in our community.

one_reviews_text: i just started i have no account and i still played until i met a nice person we chated for a while until it kicked me out and it won't let me back in pls help
review_feedback: Hey Intricate77. We recommend creating an account so we can better investigate bans or kicks in the future. In the meantime, so sorry to hear about that. In the future, you can open a ticket with our help desk as well: altvr.com/support/

one_reviews_text: got this i had fun for like an hour and then was at the camp and then got kicked of every time i load it i just goes black then kicks me of re installed it and still does not work pls some one help me fix
review_feedback: Hi Zach_124. So sorry to hear about your issues logging in. Please open a ticket with our help desk so we can get some more info and help you get back into AltspaceVR ASAP! altvr.com/support/

one_reviews_text: I like the “events“ option. If you’re not interested in “socializing“ with strangers, attending an event is a nice alternative. The tutorial was good and useful. The interface seems logical and well laid out. It has a lot of user created worlds, but finding a particular world of interest is not easy. The thumbnails don’t give a good idea of what a world looks like, and it doesn’t remember the place you left off last time, meaning there’s a lot of scrolling. I was trying to find the Halloween environment that drew my attention to the app in the first place but wasnt able to. Finally, the app seem to lose track of my hands a lot. Granted, I was sitting, but my left hand kept flying off to the right of me. I went into the Sensor Bounds app afterwards and admittedly, my left hand did go out of bounds when resting on the arm of my chair but it still did a better job of remembering and tracking where it was.
review_feedback: Hi cybernettr! Thanks for the helpful feedback. We'll let our dev team know about your hand-tracking issues. As always, please know you can get live support for any troubleshooting needs via our Help Desk: help.altvr.com. We'll also take your Worlds feedback into account. You make some great points!

one_reviews_text: just got the game thought it was good, i joined a game a got banned for NOTHING terrible game
review_feedback: Hey CarterSt123. We take our Community Guidelines very seriously in order to ensure that AltspaceVR is safe, welcoming, and mature. If you'd like us to investigate a ban on your account, we'd be happy to do so. Just send us a note via our help desk: altvr.com/support/

one_reviews_text: a mod kicked me for being in the campfire and saying satan is coming, good game bad mods
review_feedback: Hey babafish. We take our Community Standards very seriously and encourage you to be your best self in AltspaceVR. It's what makes our community so great!

review_title: Hoping for more events to come
one_reviews_text:
Honestly, I wasn't really interested in social apps like this.  I happened to be looking for some free apps and accidentally ran across this...thought I'd check it out.
I was pleasantly surprised.  Again, I'm not really very "social" and I know that's what the whole point of this app is, but I can still get something out of it by attending events, casually running into others and saying "Hey", and basically observing how others interact with each other.
I would love for there to be more events since that's really what I get out of Altspace the most.  So I'll keep coming back to see what events are coming up.
Oh, and by the way: That's an AWESOME option to be able to see what events are coming up.  For someone like me who's really mostly interested in events, I don't want to have to go into VR to find out what's coming up.  Getting on the web and/or getting email notices about upcoming events is an extremely valuable feature. 
Thanks for that!  :)
review_feedback: Hey Danakin65! Thanks for the lovely review. We're always up for having more events in ASVR. If you've got a specific idea that you want to try out, we say go for it. Creating an event in AltspaceVR is easy and quick :)

review_title: The best VR social app. Period.
one_reviews_text: Wow...I'm writing this review after my first night in AltSpace and it will be one that I will never forget...in real life or virtual. AltSpace has proven that virtual experiences can be just as good or better than real life when it comes to the social space. For about 4 hours I was literally in another world, I started the night off by attending an open mic session which was jam packed with people doing music and comedy while the crowd gave much love to each and every person who got on stage. I made a friend after the show and we talked out in the lobby for a few minutes just to realize that we were the only ones still in the building. We agreed to go to the campgrounds and see what was happening there. We saw several groups of people but then proceeded to this particular group near a fence. For the next 3 hours, we played trivia games that was hosted by a single individual like a game show and I have never seen anything so naturally happen in video games. The whole night was just like going out on the town in real life, you don't know what will happen and who you will meet. This app has repaired my social life to a point where I would rather meet and hang out with people in AltSpace instead of doing it in real life....it's that good of a VR app. Don't know where any negative reviews are coming from but this game is super mature, accurate with making you feel like you're really hanging out with people, visually appealing and downright fun. Get this app now.
review_feedback: Hi corprinus! Wow, it sounds like you've really been getting the FULL AltspaceVR experience. We're so happy to hear you're livin' it up in the metaverse. Thanks for your kind words & thanks for being part of our community.

review_title: A more mature and civil social game.
one_reviews_text:
I have four main social games that I play: Rec Room, VR Chat, Bigscreen, and AltSpace. AltSpace has by far the most mature audience and players. You can get away from most of the children under the age of 13 in this game. You can find people of all ages up to 60 that I've seen. You'll join in a world and find people talking with each other and you can just walk right up and join in the conversation. 

This game also features events that people can host and schedule such as weight loss discussion, meditation, and even an LGBTQ+ community room. The avatars aren't too annoying and pretty basic yet unique. I also love that this game supports the Oculus Go and Gear VR so you can talk with people using all different tiers of headsets.

I really appreciate this game for what it is, and I think most people will to.
Give it a try, it's free!
review_feedback: Hi HYPERGECKO405, thanks for the feedback! Appreciate it :)

one_reviews_text:
Reasonable events, terrible avatars.

 But at least it works again.
review_feedback: Hi Allotropes :) we're all about community. If you have any questions, come find us at Campfire. Happy to show you around! See you in-world.

review_title: You've Come a Long Way, Baby
one_reviews_text:
I've been an AltSpace member since it started.  During it's early days, many of us who were early adopters of VR felt like we were pioneers as we walked through the spaces and played endless rounds of Cards Against Humanity while listening to music.  Unfortunately many of us dropped off and lost touch. 

I hadn't been on it in almost a year and what a nice surprise to see how much AltSpace has evolved since those early days.  The experience is more streamlined and they now make it easier to customize your space without having to learn their ThreeJS-based API. There is a lot of creativity afoot now and tons of new spaces to explore...even Cards Against Humanity (now known as Cards Against Reality) has been given a facelift.

If you want a relatively friendly space to hang out in VR, I would definitely recommend AltSpace VR.
review_feedback: Hanover, thank you! Will share with team :) Appreciate the feedback. The community has definitely grown over the past year. Happy to have you back! Come say hi at Wednesday's Mingle & Chill. See you in-world!

one_reviews_text: I just need help It says I purchased it but how do I use it?
review_feedback: Hi Oculus_FanGurl. Sorry to hear you're having trouble. After download, Altspace should be available for you to access in your library. If you're encountering issues, feel free to open a ticket with our help desk and we'll work together on finding a solution: help.altvr.com

one_reviews_text:
In my experience AltSpace VR has been what I can only describe as a very... okay experience. The game works fine, the controls are solid, a decent few items are interactable and private worlds allow for some party games or cool effects. And because this game features on mobile and standalone theres alot of opportunity to meet a more diverse crowd of people than you would in other games. Where this game falls flat though is there is almost zero room to be unique or give yourself individuality. Alot of the unique props and avatars have long since been purged from the game so most players look the same. This means that any interaction you have is soley based on your charisma and nothing to do with your creativity. Even the party games mentioned before suffer due to this as they are all only avaliable in private or hosted worlds which means you can get kicked before you even load in or not even allowed to play because a majority of the participants have to vote you in.
In short, if you like talking to people and meeting new people this game is fantastic but if you're the kind who wants something to do with you newfound friends theres better alternatives out there.
review_feedback: Hi VeryCreativeName, thanks for the feedback! Much appreciated. Hope to see you at our weekly Mingle & Chills to continue the conversation. See you in-world!

one_reviews_text:
First experience on this was last year & it sucked because there were no users online. Second time (20 min ago) sucked. User interface is clean & crispy. Tutorial quick & comprehensive. Was excited. Went to the campfire & see a bunch of dudes huddled around some chick singing the shape of you. She had a nice & generic disney channel voice .  I cried from the back of the crowd "GaaYY!" with 
comedic intentions. Turns out she didn't like it so shhe lectured me on the "community guidlines for lude & unwanted behavior"  & blocked me out of my account. I guess she's a Community Mod lol she didnt even warn me... Does this coont go around bossanova Nshiet banninng everyone she doesn't like?? You can tell alot about a person's character by how they use authority. Too bad one snowflakey Mod had to ruin Altspace for me. I was looking foward to applying to this company to via codepen.io but now i dnt want to because i'll probably backhand that bissh if i meet her.
UPDATE: Dev response is BS. lol. i'm taking my coding/3d modelling experience somewhere else. F this company & its snowflake sugar cookie culture.

My GF had an issue with people being rude to her when she was exploring a room and I appreciate the Dev's prompt response. If we experience this again in the future, we know who to turn to. Thank you and have a great day!
review_feedback: Hi Soluna_Eclipse, thanks for sharing this experience with us. We appreciate the feedback. We're sorry to hear this happened. Hope you visit us again and give social VR a second chance. We take great pride in our friendly and caring our community is. A great majority of our events are hosted by our community! If this happens again, come find us at Campfire—we've got the orange tags. We're aware of trolls on social VR and how hurtful cyber bullying can be. That's why we're here to support, assist, and make sure AltspaceVR is fun for everyone.

Would also suggest you check out our World Building Kits if you're into 3D spatial art and design. See you in the Metaverse!

review_title: Holding the VR Front on Every Side
one_reviews_text: There are no 2 ways about it, Altspace is the pinnacle of VR Sociality. Some networks offer you greater personal customisation, but invariably come with greatly reduced connectivity. Some provide a greater focus on games, mini- or otherwise, but often come with less developed social personalities amongst their communities. Altspace VR offers a wide variety of experiences, games, social settings, community outlets and development opportunities, without pushing the system so much that it is as unreliable as other apps. Overall I find Altspace to be the perfect place for the present era of VR technology and functionality, a place that is always growing and filled with rich and creative citizens. PS: It's also very easy to avoid and/or remove yourself from the kind of moronic, adversarial children that often swarm social networks, definately not the least important reason on my list...
review_feedback: Allo YiKwang, thanks for the feedback. Much appreciated. Have shared this comment with the development team. We're always trying to improve AltspaceVR and grow our communities. See you in-world! :)

Hands down best social VR app. There is so much to do and many scheduled events. Would be very willing to spend money for more avatar customization.

Commendable for being the first true social VR game out the door in Oculus Home.  The graphics aren't particularly impressive compared to what else is out there (High Fidelity) and what is coming (Sansar).  Also, the frequency with which the application updates is obnoxious.

AltSpace is coded in a way to be compatible across platforms, that means it has to run also on GearVR and phones. This is why they have a very limited choice of avatars, low poly objects etc.
I hate to say it because this would have SO MUCH potential, but you're essentially playing a "phone app" on your $700 Oculus (or Vive for that matter) which imho is a joke. I do understand however that currently  most people are checking out VR on mobile devices and that a social VR platform right now cannot just ignore the mainstream users. If you're fine with low poly, very limited avatar choices and simply want to chat with people I guess it's "ok", simply because it's the VR app with the most people right now.
From a technical point of view utterly disappointing since, remember, everything in Altspace also needs to run on phones.

I loved this game on my samsung gear vr, so i thought id get my self a new computer with the new oculus rift. was ready to play it last night. but it didn't work. it told me to login. and when i put my email adress in it wouldn't let me. i keep trying to put this symble in "-" and it make it to "1-2". please get this working. cuz i did not spend this much money to find out i cant play..

(if anyone can also help me figer this out. would be nice. thanks.)

JJ.

review_title: no left handed option is annoying
one_reviews_text: I'll happily come back and change this review if they ever give me the ability to swap the hand preference - I've read in various places that there is no desire to change this but we'll see how we go. the continual updates are annoying spam in the notification list, and you lose other stuff in the noise some days.

review_title: One of the best Social VR applications
one_reviews_text: While Altspace certainly isn't perfect and I believe there's much room for improvement. I think they've done a better job than and have a superior experience over most other Social VR applications I've tried. Do a few activities, meet a few cool people, and it becomes very addictive (but in a good way :).
hangout and have fun in VR for free!
This is nice, works crossplatform and support leapmotion tracker, Vive, Rift, GearVR, Touches! Graphics might not be the best! No Oculus Avatar support but their own avatars.
cool (and kind of weird) hanging out with people. worth trying out!

Good but not find more people, spain, brasil and Portuguese! :/

The UI is incredibly buggy.  The UX is pretty horrible.  When you try to log in, a virtual keyboard pops up, but this keyboard intersects with other UI elements which makes it impossible to actually hit all the possible keys.  In order to log in, the only way is to use an actual keyboard, but if you take off your headset to do this it becomes impossible to log in because your headset is no longer "looking" at the menu so you can't see it on your screen.  At times parts of the menu system simply stop loading (I had this happen several times with the window where you are supposed to be able to customize your avatar) and your only choice is to quit the app and reload to get working menus.  Using the actual "quit" button in the menu doesn't quit the app, it simply crashes it so you are left with a black screen and the only way to get back to Oculus Home is to take off your headset, and kill the app in Windows.  When trying to grab objects (like glowsticks and torches in the various rooms) the detection radius for grabbing is incredibly small which makes it super awkward to interact with anything (if your controller is not in the perfect position, it simply won't register despite my characters hand model intersecting with the object I'm trying to grab).  Many apps and games in the Oculus store are incredibly polished and have a great UX. This is not one of them.
Really Fun

Has to be one of the coolest hangout spots in VR right now. Always on the leading edge of VR device support and entertainment. I've never seen so many people on so many different VR devices hang out in one spot. I've met a ton of cool people and seen some big stars right in VR. 

Hands down most hours spent in VR to date in this app.
Still exploring, and love the community being built here. Hop in, your people are here.

There are characters with four hands at the moment. A while ago they had a talk about how much love they put into creation of their character models. Seriously? I wanted to participate on two live events (which are at 4 AM for me), one was delayed by half an hour and the other one was delayed by an hour and then canceled without futher information. This needs much more love. I fear this is a typical unfinished unity prototype, which will never be really bug-free.

Altspace VR is probably one of the best social VR platform you can have right now. Lot of different places and people to meet,tons of devices supported with motion controllers as well.

My only complain is on the artistic side. With such a wide and well-done VR support they could have took a better approach/quality to the visuals. The avatars are too often with some bad textures quality and even the choice of them sometimes are just not well fit in VR. Too much weird avatars and isn't always so simple to interact with other people when the avatar is so weird you can't even understand where they're looking.

The overall quality of the places and look/feel should also go a lot higher to meet the standards that the application has in other fields. The lights are often dull,the 3D assets too much low-poly especially for PC. It looks like they just made few amateurish scenarios in Unity just to be ready as quick as possible but i think it's now time to improve a lot this aspect.

I'd rather prefer 1/2 well/high-quality scenario instead of tons of low-quality ones.

review_title: Good but Rec Rooms is better
one_reviews_text: Deleting until they stop pushing updates through because its getting annoying. Save your updates and push them through as a proper patch rather than daily. Many people feel that its because you are trying to keep visibility on Oculus Home by daily updates.

review_title: Best Social VR App at Present
one_reviews_text: This is the best social VR app at present. I spend more time in this app than all others combined. I highly recommend it.

review_title: Not perfect yet but still really good...
one_reviews_text:
One of the best places to hang out and meet nice people. Watch YT or netflix, play some (simple) games or share your web browser with friends. If you know java and html and want to go a step further donload the SDK and build your own Room.
A nice mancave or the model of a molecule,
maybe. The choice is yours.
Oh and one last thing, I love the (experimental) Kinect support. Feels so wierd to use my real arms in VR... �
This is a great application to socialize with people.  Lot's of options and things to do from watching Youtube with a group of people to playing D&D or Cards Against Humanity.  Good stuff!

Constant updates. Sometimes several in one day. Seems like a scheme to keep alerts popping up in my notifications.

I'm uninstalling, and I recommend you stay away.
TeamTP said it beautifully. I understand the need to update games to improve them, but the frequency implies there was a lot to improve. AltspaceVR has been upd- uninstalled.

Need to be able to turn off auto updates for this app as the developers think its acceptable to update the app many times a day, sometimes every hour. Uses way too much bandwidth when I'm not even using it.
